PersonalInfos.Name: Ankit Kumar
PersonalInfos.Heading: Backend Developer | .NET | REST APIs | SQL | Async Systems

Summary: Backend Developer with 3+ years of experience building and modernizing high-traffic flight booking systems using .NET and Python. Strong in REST API design, async programming, SQL optimization, and large-scale WCF to .NET 8 migration. Experienced with third-party integrations, scheduler services, and Linux-based deployments.

Certifications.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java
Data Structures and Algorithms Using Python

WorkExperience.Overview: Backend engineer working on core flight booking platforms, API integrations, and system modernization.
Responsibilities: Built and maintained scalable REST APIs supporting search, reprice, booking, and ticketing flows.
Integrated 60+ third-party airline APIs (GDS, LCC, NDC).
Migrated legacy WCF (.NET 4.7.2) services to modern .NET 8 REST APIs.
Refactored blocking code into async/await flows, reducing CPU usage and improving throughput.
Optimized SQL Server and MongoDB queries for high-traffic production workloads.
Developed background scheduler services for monitoring, reporting, and automation.
Enabled Linux-based deployments using Kestrel and cross-platform hosting.

Projects.Description: Core backend services for flight search, booking, and ticketing with multiple airline providers.
Projects.Outcome: Improved booking stability and reduced API latency through async processing.

Projects.Description: Incremental migration of a large legacy WCF platform to modern REST APIs with parallel production support.
Projects.Outcome: Modernized critical systems with zero business disruption.

PersonalProjects.Description: Digital clock app for study sessions and desk timers. Supports 12/24-hour format with custom themes.
Interactive app for learning multiplication tables with audio-based teaching and gamified tests.
Mental math practice app with adaptive difficulty scaling and timed challenges.
